raw:
THE PREVENTION OF ANTI-NATIONAL ACTIVITIES ACT, 1974 CONTENTS 1. Short title, extent and commencement 2. Definitions CHAPTER II ANTI-NATIONAL ASSOCIATIONS 3. Declaration of an association as anti-national 4. Reference to Tribunal 5. Tribunal 6. Finality, and cancellation, of notification 7. Power to prohibit the use of funds of an anti-national association 8. Power to notify places used for purposes of an anti-national association 9. Procedure to be followed in the disposal of applications under this Act CHAPTER III OFFENCES AND PENALTIES 10. Penalty for being member of an anti-national association 11. Penalty for dealing with funds of an anti-national association 12. Penalty for contravention of an order made in respect of a notified place 13. Punishment for anti-national activities CHAPTER IV MISCELLANEOUS 14. Continuance of association 15. Bar of jurisdiction, etc. 16. Prosecution for offences under this Act 17. Protection of action taken in good faith 18. Power to delegate. 19. Act, etc., to override other laws 20. Power to make rules 21. Repeal, etc. THE PREVENTION OF ANTI-NATIONAL ACTIVITIES ACT, 1974 ACT NO. VII OF 1974 [9th February, 1974] An Act to provide for the more effective prevention of certain anti-national and treasonable activities WHEREAS the freedom of association guaranteed by Article 17 of the Constitution is subject to any reasonable restrictions imposed by law in the interest of morality or public order; AND WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the more effective prevention of certain anti-
national and treasonable activities of individuals and associations and for matters connected therewith; It is hereby enacted as follows:- 1. Short title, extent and commencement. (1) This Act may be called the Prevention of Anti-National Activities Act, 1974. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once. 2. Definitions. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,- (a) â€œanti-national activit
law_name: The Prevention of Anti-National Activities Act, 1974
